intro: Ichnocarpus serpyllifolius, commonly known as the grassy burr or devil's claw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces distinctive, spiny capsules that contain seeds with a hard, angular coat. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae), which includes many nitrogen-fixing species. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological and agricultural contexts.
